payload.name: model-based-simulation
payload.core: Execute a formal or semi-formal model forward in time or across parameter space to predict system behavior under specified conditions.
out: sensitivity analyses mapping parameter variations to outcomes
boundary identification where behavior changes qualitatively
distribution of outcomes from Monte Carlo runs
proc: specify model: state variables, transition rules, assumptions
define scenarios: initial conditions, parameter ranges, inputs
run simulations across scenarios, record traces
analyze outputs: summary statistics, patterns, boundaries
report with caveats on assumptions and untested regions
check: at least one boundary/stress case tested
validation check against empirical data documented

diff.mechanistic-40: running mechanism vs explaining why it works
diff.robust-worst-case-49: exploring parameter space vs optimizing bounds

fail.signal: conclusions without caveats; no validation; no sensitivity analysis; false precision
mitigations: validate at least one prediction against measured reality

ex.task: evaluate message queue for Black Friday traffic
ex.model: queue with arrival rate lambda, processing rate mu, buffer B; Poisson arrivals, exponential service
ex.output: at 5x traffic, 12% drops (95% CI 9-15%); with +20% processing and 10x buffer, <1% drops
ex.validation: model predicted P99 450ms, observed 520ms; underestimates tail
